data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: The more laws and order are made prominent, the more thieves and robbers there will be.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: Great indeed is the sublimity of the Creative, to which all beings owe their beginning and which permeates all heaven.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: Treat those who are good with goodness, and also treat those who are not good with goodness. Thus goodness is attained. Be honest to those who are honest, and be also honest to those who are not honest. Thus honesty is attained.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: When you are content to be simply yourself and don't compare or compete, everybody will respect you.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: Silence is a source of great strength.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: Health is the greatest possession. Contentment is the greatest treasure. Confidence is the greatest friend. Non-being is the greatest joy.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: Manifest plainness, embrace simplicity, reduce selfishness, have few desires.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: A leader is best when people barely know he exists, when his work is done, his aim fulfilled, they will say: we did it ourselves.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: The wicked leader is he who the people despise. The good leader is he who the people revere. The great leader is he who the people say, 'We did it ourselves.'

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: Without stirring abroad, One can know the whole world; Without looking out of the window One can see the way of heaven. The further one goes The less one knows.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: Anticipate the difficult by managing the easy.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: There was something undifferentiated and yet complete, which existed before Heaven and Earth. Soundless and formless, it depends on nothing and does not change. It operates everywhere and is free from danger. It may be considered the mother of the universe. I do not know its name; I call it Tao.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: To the mind that is still, the whole universe surrenders.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: Heaven is long-enduring, and earth continues long. The reason why heaven and earth are able to endure and continue thus long is because they do not live of, or for, themselves.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: One who is too insistent on his own views, finds few to agree with him.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: One can not reflect in streaming water. Only those who know internal peace can give it to others.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: He who is contented is rich.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: If you would take, you must first give, this is the beginning of intelligence.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: The key to growth is the introduction of higher dimensions of consciousness into our awareness.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: Be the chief but never the lord.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: In dwelling, live close to the ground. In thinking, keep to the simple. In conflict, be fair and generous. In governing, don't try to control. In work, do what you enjoy. In family life, be completely present.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: Violence, even well intentioned, always rebounds upon oneself.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: To know yet to think that one does not know is best; Not to know yet to think that one knows will lead to difficulty.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: To see things in the seed, that is genius.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: For the wise man looks into space and he knows there is no limited dimensions.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: People in their handlings of affairs often fail when they are about to succeed. If one remains as careful at the end as he was at the beginning, there will be no failure.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: When a nation is filled with strife, then do patriots flourish.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: Do the difficult things while they are easy and do the great things while they are small. A journey of a thousand miles must begin with a single step.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: Sincere words are not fine; fine words are not sincere.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: How could man rejoice in victory and delight in the slaughter of men?

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: To lead people walk behind them.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: Respond intelligently even to unintelligent treatment.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: Love is of all passions the strongest, for it attacks simultaneously the head, the heart and the senses.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: Life is a series of natural and spontaneous changes. Don't resist them - that only creates sorrow. Let reality be reality. Let things flow naturally forward in whatever way they like.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: Nothing is softer or more flexible than water, yet nothing can resist it.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: He who talks more is sooner exhausted.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: Knowing others is wisdom, knowing yourself is Enlightenment.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: Great acts are made up of small deeds.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: The snow goose need not bathe to make itself white. Neither need you do anything but be yourself.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: A good traveler has no fixed plans, and is not intent on arriving.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: Man takes his law from the Earth; the Earth takes its law from Heaven; Heaven takes its law from the Tao. The law of the Tao is its being what it is.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: He who does not trust enough, Will not be trusted.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: Governing a great nation is like cooking a small fish - too much handling will spoil it.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: I do not concern myself with gods and spirits either good or evil nor do I serve any.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: All things in the world come from being. And being comes from non-being.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: If you do not change direction, you may end up where you are heading.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: He who knows, does not speak. He who speaks, does not know.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: The sage does not hoard. The more he helps others, the more he benefits himself, The more he gives to others, the more he gets himself. The Way of Heaven does one good but never does one harm. The Way of the sage is to act but not to compete.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: Man's enemies are not demons, but human beings like himself.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: At the center of your being you have the answer; you know who you are and you know what you want.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: All difficult things have their origin in that which is easy, and great things in that which is small.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: Life and death are one thread, the same line viewed from different sides.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: Music in the soul can be heard by the universe.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: He who knows that enough is enough will always have enough.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: Because of a great love, one is courageous.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: He who obtains has little. He who scatters has much.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: The Tao that can be told is not the eternal Tao; the name that can be named is not the eternal name. The Nameless is the origin of Heaven and Earth; the Named is the mother of all things.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: Be content with what you have; rejoice in the way things are. When you realize there is nothing lacking, the whole world belongs to you.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: The softest things in the world overcome the hardest things in the world.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: He who knows himself is enlightened.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: The people are hungry: It is because those in authority eat up too much in taxes.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: Fill your bowl to the brim and it will spill. Keep sharpening your knife and it will blunt.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: By letting it go it all gets done. The world is won by those who let it go. But when you try and try. The world is beyond the winning.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: To realize that you do not understand is a virtue; Not to realize that you do not understand is a defect.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: He who knows others is wise. He who knows himself is enlightened.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: The wise man does not lay up his own treasures. The more he gives to others, the more he has for his own.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: Those who have knowledge, don't predict. Those who predict, don't have knowledge.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: Kindness in words creates confidence. Kindness in thinking creates profoundness. Kindness in giving creates love.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: In the world there is nothing more submissive and weak than water. Yet for attacking that which is hard and strong nothing can surpass it.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: Of all that is good, sublimity is supreme. Succeeding is the coming together of all that is beautiful. Furtherance is the agreement of all that is just. Perseverance is the foundation of all actions.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: An ant on the move does more than a dozing ox.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: Nature is not human hearted.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: The power of intuitive understanding will protect you from harm until the end of your days.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: When the best leader's work is done the people say, 'We did it ourselves.'

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: Ambition has one heel nailed in well, though she stretch her fingers to touch the heavens.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: The higher the sun ariseth, the less shadow doth he cast; even so the greater is the goodness, the less doth it covet praise; yet cannot avoid its rewards in honours.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: If the Great Way perishes there will morality and duty. When cleverness and knowledge arise great lies will flourish. When relatives fall out with one another there will be filial duty and love. When states are in confusion there will be faithful servants.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: He who controls others may be powerful, but he who has mastered himself is mightier still.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: The career of a sage is of two kinds: He is either honored by all in the world, Like a flower waving its head, Or else he disappears into the silent forest.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: When virtue is lost, benevolence appears, when benevolence is lost right conduct appears, when right conduct is lost, expedience appears. Expediency is the mere shadow of right and truth; it is the beginning of disorder.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: Nature does not hurry, yet everything is accomplished.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: If you realize that all things change, there is nothing you will try to hold on to. If you are not afraid of dying, there is nothing you cannot achieve.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: From wonder into wonder existence opens.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: Simulated disorder postulates perfect discipline; simulated fear postulates courage; simulated weakness postulates strength.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: From caring comes courage.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: Truthful words are not beautiful; beautiful words are not truthful. Good words are not persuasive; persuasive words are not good.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: It is better to do one's own duty, however defective it may be, than to follow the duty of another, however well one may perform it. He who does his duty as his own nature reveals it, never sins.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: He who conquers others is strong; He who conquers himself is mighty.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: If you keep feeling a point that has been sharpened, the point cannot long preserve its sharpness.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: When I let go of what I am, I become what I might be.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: A scholar who cherishes the love of comfort is not fit to be deemed a scholar.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: The journey of a thousand miles begins with one step.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: Govern a great nation as you would cook a small fish. Do not overdo it.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: Mastering others is strength. Mastering yourself is true power.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: The words of truth are always paradoxical.

data.author: Lao Tzu
data.en: I have just three things to teach: simplicity, patience, compassion. These three are your greatest treasures.
